intro: Antigonon cordatum, commonly known as the heartleaf antigonon, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes other flowering plants with similar floral structures. Antigonon cordatum is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive foliage and blooms.
